# Split the text into words
    words = text.split()

    word_count = len(words)

    punctuation_count = len(re.findall(r'[{}]'.format(re.escape(PUNCTUATION)), text))

    # Return the number of words and punctuation marks
    return len(words), punctuation_count

# Use regex to find all words (alphanumeric characters separated by whitespace) and punctuation marks
    words = re.findall(r'\b\w+\b', text)

    # Return the counts as a tuple
    return len(words), len(punctuation_marks)

# Remove any leading and trailing whitespace characters
    text = text.strip()

    # Remove any spaces between punctuation and words
    text = re.sub(r'\s*([%s])\s*' % re.escape(PUNCTUATION), r'\1', text)

    # Count the number of words and punctuation marks
    word_count = len(re.findall(r'\S+', text))
    punctuation_count = len(re.findall(r'[%s]' % re.escape(PUNCTUATION), text))

    return (word_count, punctuation_count)

word_count = len(re.findall(r'\b\w+\b', text))
    punct_count = len(re.findall(f'[{re.escape(PUNCTUATION)}]', text))
    return word_count, punct_count

# Split the string into words and punctuation marks using regex
    words_and_punctuation = re.findall(r'\w+|[^\w\s]', text)

    # Count the number of words and punctuation marks
    num_words = sum(1 for item in words_and_punctuation if item not in PUNCTUATION)
    num_punctuation = sum(1 for item in words_and_punctuation if item in PUNCTUATION)

    return (num_words, num_punctuation)

# Count the number of words using the split() method
    num_words = len(text.split())

    # Count the number of punctuation marks using regex
    num_punctuation = len(re.findall(r'[{}]'.format(re.escape(string.punctuation)), text))

    # Return the results as a tuple
    return (num_words, num_punctuation)
